alert.note: Alert for Angelina; Jasper; Polk; Tyler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 10:12AM CST until January 30 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Neches River At Rockland affecting Polk, Tyler, Angelina and Jasper Counties. For the Neches River...including Lake Palestine, Neches, Alto, Diboll, Rockland...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neches River at Rockland. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Water will begin to flood several secondary roadways especially in the Smith`s Ferry community. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 27.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CST Monday was 27.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 20.6 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.5 feet on 03/17/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1015 AM CST.
